intro: Luzula ruiz-lealii, commonly known as the Ruiz-Leal's wood rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Argentina and Chile. The plant features dense, grass-like foliage with narrow, dark green leaves that form a tufted rosette at the base. Its flowering stems bear small, spike-like inflorescences that produce tiny, three-lobed flowers. Luzula ruiz-lealii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands and forest understories.
